# Azure Open AI Summarization Use case

This notebook provides an example code showing how to use the Open AI packages for the bulk chat completion for summarization use case. The verbatim dataset is loaded from Azure datalake which contains the verbaige for the specific plant operation defect condition. We are going to summarize that through Open AI GPT3.5 LLM and store the result in the enriched dataset back to datalake.

# Required imports
import openai
import re
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import json
import requests

# Setup Azure OpenAI environment
openai.api_type = "azure"
openai.api_key = "<API_KEY>"
openai.api_base = "https://<RESOURCE_NAME>.openai.azure.com/"
openai.api_version = "2023-03-15-preview"
### Mount Datalake path for accessing datasets

# Update parameters for your environment
storage_account = 'datapoclake'
container_name = 'datasets'
subfolder = 'cognitive/datasets/OpenAI'
linkedServiceName = "synapse-edge-WorkspaceDefaultStorage"

mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/openai")
mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
    f"abfss://{container_name}@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{subfolder}/", 
    "/openai", 
    {"linkedService":linkedServiceName} 
) 

jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId() 
print(f"Job Id: {jobId}")

# s is input text
def normalize_text(s, sep_token = " \n "):
    s = re.sub(r'\s+',  ' ', s).strip()
    s = re.sub(r". ,","",s)
    # remove all instances of multiple spaces
    s = s.replace("..",".")
    s = s.replace(". .",".")
    s = s.replace("\n", "")
    s = s.strip()
    
    return s

df['verbatim_normalized'] = df["verbatim"].apply(lambda x : normalize_text(x))
df

class Prompt:
    def __init__(self, role, content):
        self.role = role
        self.content = content


sys_prompt = Prompt(
    role="system",
    content = "You are an AI assistant that will help me succinctly summarize the failure in 2 words based on the verbatim I provide. I am looking for failure context which best describes the situation."
)
prompts = list()
prompts.append(sys_prompt)

def initiate_chat():
    global prompts, openai
    response = openai.ChatCompletion.create(
        engine="ChatGPT", # The deployment name you chose when you deployed the ChatGPT or GPT-4 model.
        messages = [sys_prompt.__dict__]
    )
    result = response['choices'][0]['message']['content']
    print(f"Result: {result}")
    prompts.append(Prompt(role="system", content=result))

# Initiate the OpenAI engine
initiate_chat()

def summarize_verbetim(v):
    global prompts, openai, sys_prompt
    message = f"Verbatim: {v} \n Code: ?"
    prompt = Prompt(role="user", content=message)
    prompts.append(prompt)
    response = openai.ChatCompletion.create(
        engine="ChatGPT", # The deployment name you chose when you deployed the ChatGPT or GPT-4 model.
        messages = [sys_prompt.__dict__, prompt.__dict__]
    )

    result = response['choices'][0]['message']['content']
    print(result)
    prompts.append(Prompt(role="system", content=result))

    return result


df['summarization'] = df["verbatim_normalized"].apply(lambda x : summarize_verbetim(x))

df_enriched = df.drop(['verbatim'], axis=1, inplace=False)
df_enriched
